page.title: 05MARTLESHAM INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: When R.A.F.Martlesham finally closed in l963 many of the forces airfield buildings were ideally suited for light industry and from a small nucleus of varied businesses, an industrial estate of some 70 firms has been established. New purpose designed buildings have been erected to house a variety of light industries whilst the hangars have become large capacity warehouses, mainly for shipping firms, Felixstowe docks being only seven miles to the South. The site is dominated by the giant British Telecom research buildings and it's tall tower which now stand on the former site of the Officer's Mess. So Martlesham Heath's fame for experimentation lives on.
